thread.title: Chemical giant Ineos to build heir to the Land Rover Defender | Business | The Guardian
thread.title_full: Chemical giant Ineos to build heir to the Land Rover Defender | Business | The Guardian

author: Mark Sweney
title: Chemical giant Ineos to build heir to the Land Rover Defender | Business | The Guardian
text:
Automotive industry Chemical giant Ineos to build heir to the Land Rover Defender 
Firm pledges to invest ‘hundreds of millions of pounds’ to plug gap in car market for ‘uncompromising’ off-road successor to now-defunct 4x4 vehicle A man passes a Land Rover Defender parked on a residential street in London. Photograph: Toby Melville/Reuters View more sharing options Monday 13 February 2017 09.36 GMT Last modified on Monday 13 February 2017 09.37 GMT 
Chemicals group Ineos is to enter the car market, launching an off-road vehicle to replace the Land Rover Defender which ceased production last year. 
Ineos, which is one of the largest manufacturing companies in the world, says it intends to invest “many hundreds of millions” on developing the new 4x4 off-road vehicle. 
The company says there is a gap in the market for an “uncompromising” off-roader following the decision by Jaguar Land Rover to stop producing its famous Defender . 
“We want to build the world’s purest 4x4 and are aiming it at explorers, farmers and off-road enthusiasts across the globe,” said Jim Ratcliffe, chairman of Ineos. 
Ineos is looking at sites across Europe to manufacture the new vehicle but hopes to find a suitable location in the UK. 
• More details to follow soon.
